exchange.core2.core.orderbook

    • Method Detail

      • newOrder

        void newOrder(OrderCommand cmd)
        Process new order. Depending on price specified (whether the order is marketable), order will be matched to existing opposite GTC orders from the order book. In case of remaining volume (order was not matched completely): IOC - reject it as partially filled. GTC - place as a new limit order into th order book.

        Rejection chain attached in case of error (to simplify risk handling)

        Parameters:
        cmd - - order to match/place

      • cancelOrder

        CommandResultCode cancelOrder(OrderCommand cmd)
        Cancel order completely.

        fills cmd.action with original original order action

        Parameters:
        cmd - - order command
        Returns:
        MATCHING_UNKNOWN_ORDER_ID if order was not found, otherwise SUCCESS

      • reduceOrder

        CommandResultCode reduceOrder(OrderCommand cmd)
        Decrease the size of the order by specific number of lots

        fills cmd.action with original order action

        Parameters:
        cmd - - order command
        Returns:
        MATCHING_UNKNOWN_ORDER_ID if order was not found, otherwise SUCCESS

      • moveOrder

        CommandResultCode moveOrder(OrderCommand cmd)
        Move order

        newPrice - new price (if 0 or same - order will not moved) fills cmd.action with original original order action

        Parameters:
        cmd - - order command
        Returns:
        MATCHING_UNKNOWN_ORDER_ID if order was not found, otherwise SUCCESS

      • findUserOrders

        List<Order> findUserOrders(long uid)
        Search for all orders for specified user.

        Slow, because order book do not maintain uid-to-order index.

        Produces garbage.

        Orders must be processed before doing any other mutable call.

        Parameters:
        uid - user id
        Returns:
        list of orders

      • stateHash

        default int stateHash()
        State hash for order books is implementation-agnostic Look validateInternalState() for full internal state validation for de-serialized objects
        Specified by:
        stateHash in interface StateHash
        Returns:
        state hash code
